newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sanwa Bank unveils second embezzlment case.
newsitem.headline: Sanwa Bank unveils second embezzlment case.

text.p: Sanwa Bank Ltd said on Thursday that it had dismissed a Tokyo-based branch official for embezzling about 27 million yen, the second such case it has unveiled this month.
A spokesman for the bank said it fired the official on September 5 after discovering in an internal investigation in August that he had embezzled customers' money for more than three years.
The official had said he would repay the money and the bank would not file a criminal complaint against him, the spokesman said.
Earlier this month, Sanwa said a former branch manager had embezzled 550 million yen. He was arrested after the bank filed a complaint against him for breach of trust.
The two cases were not related, the spokesman said.
